message: Can we get any hints as to whats to come, whats being worked on or maybe some type of changelog?

@psytek  would be nice as things seem to be slowing down at least on the activity front. I really want to see convore take off and keeping us posted and maybe even asking for help might not be a bad idea IMO.
I think attention might be elsewhere based on the bio at http://twitter.com/#!/ericflo
@justinlilly Good call, I wonder if Leah is going to be the champion of convore or if it will die :/
That's troubling
@justinlilly Good spot! I have every confidence in @Leah and the rest of the remaining Convore team. I would how ever be interested in something so special it attracted @ericflo away from Convore???
@Joltrast I agree. Traffic to Convore has already been on the decline. It isn't a good time to lose a key team member.

if your leaving the co-founder position in this short of a time, that isn't good and i bet @Leah is soon to follow, Good luck to @ericflo in anything he does, and i think if they scrap it, they should give it to open source community to grow it.
That's a bit of shame. Perhaps they've sold it on already?
Irrelevant of convore's position, I do wish more startups that don't succeed would just pop their sourcecode up somewhere. That way atleast someone can benefit from their toils.
Hang tight! There will be a new version of Convore, probably by the end of summer.
@ericflo and @etmaguire have left though... to pursue other exciting things.
@equinox - nope! Just getting a makeover.
@equinox - myself and a new team member who starts this week. I really should announce this on our blog...
@leah definitely! I guess everyone is interested to know.. my guess is that he's the new intern at convore who's coming from finland =)
Hi all! I'm still working on Convore and am in the process of re-working some of the technology and product.
We haven't been marketing the site very much because I want to make some changes first.
glad to hear that  @leah! I thought convore was dying
@leah so who's left in the team then?
This is great news.  I hope some new features make it into this version ;)  Good luck Convore.
@leah Do feel free to throw your (or someone else's) back into marketing when you finish the makeover. You're onto something here and I'd hate to see your work go to waste for a lack of users.
@equinox: spot on! started yesterday but already on full throttle :) And hi to everyone else as well!
@jorilallo good luck and I hope you can make convore grow big.. I love convore
@equinox that loving feeling is mutual, won't let you down :)
@jorilallo that's totally cool...so is the team now you and leah?
@jorilallo mind giving us a bit of a hint what you're working on?
@equinox Sorry, I think that's @leah's job ;)
@jorilallo welcome and we are all with you! Let me know if I can be of any help.
omg cant wait!

Thanks for the feedback @Leah! If you can get something up on the blog, could you mention any of fixes that are on the way? For example, we're giving Convore a shot for our business communication right now (we put our Campfire room on hold), but search has become a huge thorn in our side since it seems practically broken. Plus, am I reading it right that you're the only full timer working on Convore right now? If so, could you talk a little about that and what kind of a future Convore has as a product?
hi  @chartier - search seems to have a few glitches but should be running better now. Like I mentioned earlier, we're working on a technical and product revamp.
Thanks a bunch @Leah. We've checked out a few other group chat services and so far, Convore is miles ahead of them. Nice work so far.
It still works fairly well and is consistent once messages actually get saved.
It seems linkifying urls is taking longer than it used to. https://github.com/convore
I looked at the POST request generated with that message in Chrome Inspector and it took 4.67s to get a response.
I really like convore, and if it has indeed slowed, I hope you fix it soon!

@bat consider your 4.67s a god sent, i have been getting around 10s and the pages sometimes just timeout, even the API is having timeout issues and i am working on a cool thing for convore but it is so hard to test that i just have it load from saved json replies because the loading was killing me
@italiano40 thanks for confirming this. I'm pretty sure it's not just me now. (the opposite of Works On My Machine: Broken On My Machine)
http://codinghorror.typepad.com/.a/6a0120a85dcdae970b0128776ff992970c-pi
@craigshipp yea load times are kinda a HUGE issue and need to be fix ASAP that could make or break a user
let's give Leah some time. She said she's working on it.
